ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was
What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I feel that my French really improved!
I improved my French speaking and listening skills, as well as my knowledge of vocabulary and grammar.
I learned how to conjugate all main French tenses and learned tons of new vocabulary.
I gained a greater understanding of the grammar of the language and learned how to comprehend and respond to French texts.
I learned so much French through this course due to the format. I definitely took out more conversational skills because of how media-oriented it was.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: All of the content of this course was great, but it was a bit challenging to do over the internet. I think OWL was generally good for the tests, but there were some glitches.

Strengths: I really enjoyed the texts we read and our class discussions!
Weaknesses: I wish that we spent some time in class focusing on writing. I also think that essays should be due at the end of the week even if the tests are earlier, because having to write a composition on top of all our other weeknight homework was a LOT of work.

Strengths: Prof. Koundi is amazing. You will learn a lot very quickly, and your french will improve 100x if you put in the work.
Weaknesses: extremely fast-paced, keep up with the work or you will drown. This isn't something that can really be fixed, however.

Strengths: Books and movies were a key role in developing an understanding of the language
Weaknesses: Super fast-paced and work-heavy and can catch up to you really quickly

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, you should definitely try to get your language requirement out of the way during the summer!
It's very intense but you will learn a lot. This is the course that'll take your french from beginner to proficient.

Yes! definitely. The course is a fun course to take especially with Madame Koundi. Although the course is fast-paced, the books and films are super enjoyable. They keep you engaged in discussion and in the class overall. Everyone struggles so you won't be alone. But there will be no growth without struggle, so you get the idea.
